item.title: BMI shouldn't be the only way to assess who can access weight-loss drugs
item.description: About 1 in 3 Australian adults (32%) has a body-mass index (BMI) of 30 or above. A further 34% has a BMI of 25 or above.

item.title: 250-year-old drug enters clinical trial as potential treatment for deadly pancreatic cancer
item.description: Researchers in Sweden are testing a 250-year-old medicine in patients with one of the world's deadliest cancers.

item.title: Why time could be as critical as diet and exercise for brain health

item.title: Many children seem on track—but struggle with motor skills

item.title: Multidisciplinary study finds estrogen could aid in therapies for progressive multiple sclerosis
